body:
For what its worth, the names I recognize are typically from the comments, not the posters. And the same for myself, I like to believe adding to the discussion of the comments is enough of a contribution for myself.

I look at Ruqqus as a discussion board first and foremost. Discussions typically don't go far, but hey, that's alright, they rarely do anymore outside of private discussions and niche specialized communities.

author.bio_html:
Goodbye. https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/d9y9/i-told-you-so-all-the

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.

body:
Yeah, I can post the Babylon Bee articles before someone else does and that's *it*. Everyone else can magically find everything from all over the internet, not just specific places. Heck I created +foxes and rarely do I find something interesting that I hasn't been reposted 32109850983 times for 50 years. Yet everyone else in that guild finds stuff all the time with no effort, both from random dark corners of the internet that I everyone but me apparently knows about, and specific sources which I didn't know a single one of but *everyone* else does.

I'm also not good at making discussion or meta or idea threads, and with regards to participating in existing ones I'm always the last person to find it and by that point it's too late to say anything. Every. single. time.

It's like this is all some telepathic thing that most people share and I'm not a part of. This is *not* the only subject where this happens to me either, in fact I can't think of any parts of my life where this isn't the case, and no one else has this problem. A few times I've met someone who did, but they always soon overcome it and don't want to tell me how or why. I'm completely alone in this.

And on top of that I can't learn skills either, so if I'm interested in something I'll initially improve but then flatline and never become good enough to accomplish anything. *And* I'm not clever and can't think outside the box at *all*, so I often miss the solutions to even the simplest of problems.
body_html:
Yeah, I can post the Babylon Bee articles before someone else does and that's it. Everyone else can magically find everything from all over the internet, not just specific places. Heck I created +foxes and rarely do I find something interesting that I hasn't been reposted 32109850983 times for 50 years. Yet everyone else in that guild finds stuff all the time with no effort, both from random dark corners of the internet that I everyone but me apparently knows about, and specific sources which I didn't know a single one of but everyone else does.

I'm also not good at making discussion or meta or idea threads, and with regards to participating in existing ones I'm always the last person to find it and by that point it's too late to say anything. Every. single. time.

It's like this is all some telepathic thing that most people share and I'm not a part of. This is not the only subject where this happens to me either, in fact I can't think of any parts of my life where this isn't the case, and no one else has this problem. A few times I've met someone who did, but they always soon overcome it and don't want to tell me how or why. I'm completely alone in this.

And on top of that I can't learn skills either, so if I'm interested in something I'll initially improve but then flatline and never become good enough to accomplish anything. And I'm not clever and can't think outside the box at all, so I often miss the solutions to even the simplest of problems.

body:
The internet can be a shitty place for self esteem because it makes it SO easy to compare yourself to other people. Before it existed, you could compare yourself you your friends, family, and to an extent a few people in your larger community. But now, its the entire WORLD. Wanna play guitar? In 1.252 seconds you can stream a video of the best guitarist who ever lived. Demotivating.

Having self esteem is not really compatible with comparing yourself to other people _period_, let alone the entire planet has to offer. So sorry you're feeling disheartened, ma dude. The only thing I would say is try to compare yourself to other people less? I know it's cliche but the only thing you can compare yourself to is how you were yesterday.
body_html:
The internet can be a shitty place for self esteem because it makes it SO easy to compare yourself to other people. Before it existed, you could compare yourself you your friends, family, and to an extent a few people in your larger community. But now, its the entire WORLD. Wanna play guitar? In 1.252 seconds you can stream a video of the best guitarist who ever lived. Demotivating.

Having self esteem is not really compatible with comparing yourself to other people period, let alone the entire planet has to offer. So sorry you're feeling disheartened, ma dude. The only thing I would say is try to compare yourself to other people less? I know it's cliche but the only thing you can compare yourself to is how you were yesterday.

body: These aren't the best people in the world. These are just the people I know personally. I'm better at some of them at a few things but only when I'm interested and they're not. Everyone who has even a small interest in something is automatically light years ahead of me. I don't really care about that, but I'm *so* bad at everything that I can't accomplish anything at all, and everyone refuses to tell me how they're doing it. Everyone else has it all figured out and I don't.

Everyone else has it all figured out and I don't.
